newsitem.title: UK: IFC emerging market index down 0.1 pct at 297.03.
newsitem.headline: IFC emerging market index down 0.1 pct at 297.03.

text.p: The International Finance Corporation's composite index of emerging market equities, denominated in dollars, fell 0.1 percent to 297.03 at the start of play on Monday.
Latin America edged down 0.2 percent day-on-day to 534.71, Asia was down 0.1 percent at 252.47, and Europe, Middle East and Africa were down 0.1 percent at 140.50.
The IFC composite index touched a 1996 high of 308.77 on July 4, up from the year's 275.79 low, recorded on January 1.
ING Barings' Global Emerging Market Index, also denominated in dollars, was down 0.09 percent day-on-day at 160.74 at 1130 GMT.
The year's high was 165.948, reached on July 3. It touched the year's 148.85 low on January 2.
Morgan Stanley's dollar-denominated Emerging Markets Free index, was off 0.08 percent at 480.378, calculated after the close of play on Friday.
It touched a 1996 high at 505.452 on July 4; the year's 458.369 low was recorded on January 1.

All indices are capitalisation-weighted and are calculated daily. The IFC index measures returns on equities, liquid and accessible to foreign investors, from 26 emerging market countries. It is updated at 2300 GMT.
The BEMI index measures equity returns from some 20 emerging market countries, with the latest changes reported by 0900 GMT.
The MSCI Free measures equity returns from 22 emerging market nations. Changes are reported with one day's lag at 1300 GMT.
The J.P. Morgan emerging market local currency index, its returns calculated in dollar terms, rose 0.02 percent to 122.41 by the start of play on Monday.
By region, Latin America was up 0.08 percent to 99.88, Asia was flat at 129.29, and East Europe was down 0.07 at 159.35. --Caroline Brothers, London Newsroom +44 171 542 2734
